Installation:
Just put the files in the data folder of your Elder Scrolls V Skyrim.

Bugs:
None that I know of.

Instructions for use.

1 - Choose the Follower with anyone Can Be The Possibility of a follower in your script Vanilla, most are possible.
2 - Open the console.
3 - Select the ID by clicking the mouse on the character (I advise the head because there are no errors).
4 - Use comand \"bat setfollower\": This command will open the dialogue for characters to be his follower. (THIS IS NOT MY MOD THEN THE CREDIT FOR IT IS NOT MY).
5 - Close the console and talk to the character, the option for him to be his follower will be open.
6 - Select the character as a follower.
7 - Open the console.
8 - Select the id of the Follower. (clicking on it again with the mouse).
9 - To Avoid problems in the Difficulty of the game, use the command: setlevel (your level) without the quotes, it will make the character go to your Chosen level. recomendo que use o comando 2x ou 3x, pois nem sempre pega de primeira, pois na verdade o follower deveria estar sem itens.
10 - Soon after giving the command if you want. close and reopen the console. If you do not use the command setlevel then skip step 10.
11 - Open the console and use the command According to The Chosen class.
Mage: \"bat setmagelvl1\"
Warrior: \"bat setwarriorlvl1\"
Nightblade: \"bat setnightbladelvl1\"
Ranger: \"bat setrangerlvl1\"
ps: to Levels 2 and 3 only change (lvl) example \"bat setmagelvl3.\"

RECOMMEND USE Levels:
LEVEL1: Any.
LEVEL 2: LEVEL 18 ~ 20.
LEVEL 3: LEVEL 30 ~ 40.

12 - Exit the console.
PS: commands without the quotes.
PS2: Do not use the level 2 or 3 before the first, if not, will not work.
IMPORTANT USE BEFORE ALL LEVEL 1.

\"If you do not understand anything just watch my video demo.\"


Some Recommended Commands:

setlevel (your level): This command causes your follower go to the same level as yours, USE CAUTION BEFORE USING THE MOD CLASS, BUT BECAUSE HE WILL RETURN TO THE STANDARD.
showinventory: To see the items in the Follower.
RemoveItem (item id): To remove the item from the Follower.
setav (eg health or skill): Increases the amount of the particular skill or stamina eg setav health 300, your character would get to 300 health.
getav (eg health or skill: You will have access to much of the chosen attribute your character possesses. exp: Getav health: Health of your follower.
addspell (id of the spell): To add a spell on your Follower.
removespell (id of the spell): To remove the spell of his Follower.
PS: All commands should be used with the id of your follower selected.
